alert.note: Alert for Mason; McCulloch; Menard; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 8:11PM CDT until May 19 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Mason, McCulloch, Menard and San Saba. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 807 PM CDT, Radar indicated a west to east band of thunderstorms with very heavy rain across Menard and northern Mason Counties. This band of storms was drifting very slowly to the south. Rainfall amounts of one half inch to 1.5 inches has already occurred, and an additional 1 to 2 inches is expected through 945 PM. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Flooding of low lying areas could occur, along with street flooding in Menard. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Menard, Hext, Camp Air, Katemcy, Fredonia, Pontotoc, The Intersection Of Highway 29 And Ranch Road 1222 and The Intersection Of Us-83 And Highway 29. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Decker St. crossing San Saba River, Hurley crossing, Katemcy crossing, Spy Rock crossing, Oak Grove crossing, Old Union crossing San Fernando Creek, Behrens School crossing Comanche Creek, Old Katemcy Mason crossing Comanche Creek, Turkey SpringS crossing and Sandy crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
